Reviews.Title: “Not high end but ok for a couple of nights.”
Reviews.Author: GDayMateAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel tries really hard. The service and cleanliness are excellent but somehow it just doesn't make the grade. The rooms are small and have few power points so charging electronics is difficult. The bed was like sleeping on concrete and the shower was old. However it is close to the best wet market in Singapore which is worth a look at in itself and the hawker stalls upstairs at the market are cheap and good. Ok for a couple of nights but we stayed a week and couldn't wait to leave at the end. Expensive for a ordinary hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “it's the one!”
Reviews.Author: kumo123
Reviews.Content: During my stay in Singapore, I'm glad I'm have chosen link hotel as my choice hotel... the hotel was clean and the staffs were friendly when I needed help... the location was rather convenient and accessible as well... most importantly it is value for money for the type of service that I received during my stay. Will definitely choose Link Hotel again the next time I visit Singapore! ((;

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honeybees10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to places that sell good food with friendly staffs to help. It is located centrally and is near to places like chinatown! Their price is reasonable. However their room is a little small but it is clean. Futhermore, there's free shuttle bus available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: brenthewer
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a few nights, and it was a nice place. very quiet, clean and the front desk staff were very quick and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. The only small downside is its a small walk to the MRT, not a bother though since there is always interesting stuff to look at

Reviews.Title: “Link Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimyY
Reviews.Content: Location is central thus accessible. Staff are friendly and helpful, making my stay all worthwhile. However the room is too small.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: layyan l
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and the wardrobe is not full length which is not good for long dresses. The plus point of the hotel is the location, which is near to the train station. Alternatively you can opt for the shuttle bus service. They do provide it to a number of central location. As compared it to the other hotels located centrally, Link Hotel is considered to be the cheapest. Room wise reasonably clean and comfortable. Unless they are other cheaper hotel located centrally, otherwise I will choose to go back to Link Hotel again. Would prefer if they can include free breakfast in the room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Poor Condition”
Reviews.Author: gelalaw
Reviews.Content: Room was pretty small, poorly lit. Complimentary shampoo/shower gel set of poor quality. Phone was not working since the cable kept falling off from the handset. Took at least 10 mins walk to nearest subway station. Good things were... friendly staff and complimentary internet cable in the room and the breakfast was pretty alright.

Reviews.Title: “rip off and very smelly”
Reviews.Author: Divya c
Reviews.Content: Please stay away from this hotel. when i book,the hotel cost like 185 singapore dollar per day in trivago.com ,the Hotel is extremely ugly and its more look like a budget hotel,the rooms are very ugly for the costly price.not even in city center,u have to walk almost 600m to the underground station. The staff working there all unfriendly the toilet in my room stink all the time day and night. When i checkout after 3days i got to pay top on 185SGD 10% Government Tax and 7% Service charge for every single nights i stayed! Do not go to this hotel.there is a better hotel and cheaper price in the citycenter . The hotel has nothing nice to see around other then alots of locals restaurants. This Chinese greedy Hotel only wants your money!!

Reviews.Title: “Not well maintain hotel with small room”
Reviews.Author: meukpo
Reviews.Content: Hotel room a bit small, I think that is why it can only place a small bed in the room, but it will not be an idea room for people slightly on a bigger size like me. Hotel room toilet was not well maintenance. However this was compensate by good food found in nearby food centre.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: BernardLim
Reviews.Content: Pros : Average breakfast, near the Tiong Bahru food court which has a variety of good local food to choose from. Also near Chinatown which is about 15-20 mins walk away. Cons : Really crampy rooms. Barely had any space to move around. Also remembered foul odour in room, seemingly seeping from room's toilet. Another thing to note is that the walking distance from this hotel to the Tiong Bahru MRT is really far. It takes about 15 mins of walk, which is probably the last thing you'd want to do after a gruelling day of touring.

Reviews.Title: “Worn-out money-hungry hotel”
Reviews.Author: vitaly_khozyainov
Reviews.Content: Facts: 1) bathroom smells of mold, water dripping in the corner, forming a puddle; 2) towels are frayed and some are plain worn; 3) just 4 hangers in a chest-high closet, no single shelf or drawer for clothes; 4) booked over SGD 1200 on the credit card while the bill is expected at around SGD 600; 5) wired Internet is free and works well. Advice: there are hotels in Singapore that are as close to city center as Link, for similar or lower price, that are more comfortable and well maintained, which do not book on the card more than is due to them.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price in SG”
Reviews.Author: Lynette0708
Reviews.Content: Well since I have to stay in SG for more than 2wks, though it's a biz trip, still use a budget hotel. If hold an expectation like this, you won't be disappointed since things are alright, my room is quite, breakfast OK. The biggest problem is the wardrobe, the wardrobe in the room is too... low! I'm with all my one- piece dresses and when hanging them, the edges of dresses you could imagine. Location fine, I mainly use taxi. It's not difficult to get a cab in morning since they queue up there. Another issue is there is no sufficient light in the room, only table lamp and bed lamp. Broadnet is not very fast, no wifi. Anyway in a word, it's a fair price in SG.

Reviews.Title: “Couples in single beds...? again!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrazyPenguin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Link Hotel in singapore due to reviews being resonable, the property has won many boutique awards and is pretty resonable for Singapore standards for price and size. I'm used to smaller asian rooms but this was a shock to my parents on their first trip overseas. Breakfast not included and well expensive don't even bother about this. Upon checking in it took 20 minutes to sort out that we had booked Queen delux rooms and the staff tried to put us in single beds even though we are all couples. Luckily I had the printed confirmation but even with that the delay was terrible. About 10 minues walk to the nearest station to catch the train near to Sentosa, walking distance to Chinatown for food and hawker markets. Overall not a bad stay, if they were more on the ball with what ppl book and what they arrange. On a side note, the pillows are terrible!

Reviews.Title: “They have not resolved past poor reviews on toilet smell”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: The stench of sewerage plumbing wafted into the room the moment I switched off the air-conditioning. Bad. Couldn't be bothered to change room since closing the bathroom door stopped it and I have already unpacked and settled in. The smell seemed to have a timing. Wasn't there when I first got into the room. And sound proofing is rather poor where my room was; in the block opposite the main one. Door closing can be annoyingly heard.The TV volume switch should be tweaked so that there's no guessing how loud it will sound in your neighbour's room. I got a visit to the effect. Check-in was great however. Polite, efficient and prompt. High thread count bed linen for a pleasant feel. Interesting experience to iron shirt in a common area in a public space. About 600m from the nearest Outram MRT station

Reviews.Title: “Well located and friendly”
Reviews.Author: nick w
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Link Hotel for 3 nights this week on a business trip. As others have said the rooms are not huge but they are perfectly ok and were very clean. The sound proofing is fine unless you have people having a party on your corridor (as happened the first night) but if you leave the aircon on it drowns out the noise. There was a good selection of foods for breakfast (hot and cold) and the rooftop bar has some great views even if a little pricey compared to other places nearby. There is also a good selection of complimentary shaving, dental, sewing etc kits provided. The internet access in the rooms is fast albeit that it is via ethernet connection- though there is wireless downstairs in the lobby The hotel is well located for Chinatown which is just a 15minute walk away and is close to bus and MRT stops. In short, I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Local Food Centers but Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jalee70
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the distinction of being the one that has the tiniest room I've ever stayed. There wasn't even a proper wardrobe to hang my clothes. The hotel is in very good condition, and the proximity to the Tiong Bahru food court makes it a superbly terrific place to experience the charm of a neighborhood with lots of art-deco 1970s apartments, This hotel is merely three bus stops (or a 20-minute walk) away from the MRT stop, making it easily accessible for those wanting to explore the island by public transport. Wifi's provided only in the lobby. With a convenient store in the building, this is pretty good for budget travel. Laundry charges were expensive though, and it was more than what I had to pay at a service apartment along Orange Grove Road in Singapore. Kind of unacceptable, I'd say.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice...”
Reviews.Author: MattyKel99
Reviews.Content: The Link Hotel had every mod rooms that did the job, nice to come back to at the end of the day even tho they weren’t hugh rooms. The staff were all very friendly and happy to cater for your needs, I only ate breakfast and although it wasn’t a large amount to chose from there was still enough.

Reviews.Title: “Will not come back again”
Reviews.Author: Shock70
Reviews.Content: Have paid premium price for such location. And now a days with an Ipad and no wifi in the room, need to walk to the lobby. Very inconvenient especially for people like us who may need to work through the night. Will not come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Jonno82
Reviews.Content: Mainly stayed there for a family function so didn't get to take photo of the hotel room. The hotel is conveniently located within 10 minutes walk from the subway station, only one stop from Chinatown, there is a hawker plaza nearby (5 minutes walk tops) with huge variety of food options at very cheap prices. The hotel itself is of good condition, clean and tidy, some area seems a bit dated but nothing that will make you feel uncomfortable. Free internet access provided which is a bonus! The staff are quite friendly and helpful, attitude free, makes you feel welcomed. The breakfast is quite standard, I would opt to go to the local hawkers just to try something more authentic than having the standard hotel breakfast. There has been no issues during my stay, check in and check out were both quite quick and efficient. The room was paid for so I did not know the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bartje83
Reviews.Content: Cheap by Singapore standards. Small but nice and very clean rooms. Location pretty good, about a 10 minute walk from the Outram Park metro stop. Breakfast is very good. Liked it so much we booked another night-completely blowing our backpacker's budget, but very much worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Second to none. Thumbs up!!”
Reviews.Author: KateLaurenTan
Reviews.Content: Location: Super convenient. It's only 5-7 minutes walk to Outram Park MRT Station. Very near to the City. Nearest shopping mall: Tiong Bahru Plaza. If you are planning to head down to Suntec City, Shenton Way or the MRT station, you can always catch their complimentary shuttle service. If not, hailing for a taxi is easy too. During my stay at Link Hotel, I always manage to catch a taxi within 2 minutes. Service: Staff is very flexible and accommodating. They will go the extra mile to make my stay comfortable. Nothing is too much trouble or a problem. They were very attentive and courteous. I felt special. Thanks you. Breakfast Good spread. The American Buffet Breakfast is at $15++ per person, price is very reasonable. Food was fresh - impeccable service!! Rooms & Amenities Good attention to detail. Room was clean, tidy and spacious. Besides, they provide high bed quality. I had a very comfortable stay. While they do provide mini bar, I would prefer if they have had a wider variety. That aside, the room is perfect for those on a business trip or vacation. All in all, I had a wonderful time in Singapore and will definitely stay at Link Hotel when I visit the next time. My friends from Queensland are actually visiting Singapore next week and they had also made reservation with Link Hotel Singapore. I believe they will enjoy their stay at Link too.

Reviews.Title: “Super bad smell from the toilet”
Reviews.Author: LibbyPingu
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in this hotel. On the first night, I was brushing teeth while my husband was bathing. Suddenly, a very bad smell came out. I thought it was my husband who has passed a very smelly flatus. But then, I realized the bad smell was from the toilet. I immediately close the toilet with it lid but still I could smell a bit. We have thought of chaning the room but it was late and if it is the problem of the drainage pipes, then all the rooms would have the same problem. The room is rather small and little space for open luggage if you have a big one. Noise from next room was easy to be heard, especially during check out in the morning. Walking distance from nearest MRT Outram park is about 10 minutes, fairly convenience. Some food shops nearby sell good food.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Comfort with great convenience”
Reviews.Author: MelvL
Reviews.Content: Nice place with a good all round cosy environment. Service of staff is good, location is accessible to good food and not far out from the shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Decent service, Economical Hotel, Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: hemant_i
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Link hotel from 25th to 27th March 2011 and as the title suggests the hotel is of decent caliber but the rooms are really small. The hotel receives a majority of its guests from China and most other Asian countries. Pros: Rates are not be very expensive and with a bit of bargaining you may get reasonable tariff. Be sure to include breakfast in the deal. Incredible internet speeds (included in room tariff). Cons: The windows are sealed shut and the hotel claims they are sound proof but you may have a bit of trouble sleeping specially as the street traffic sound comes right thru to your room. Try getting a room on the opposite side, they are a bit quieter than the ones facing the street. The restaurant menu is quite basic and limited to 1 main course for each meat type. The breakfast is sufficient but focussed on the chinese guests not many western options available. 1 Japanese and 1 Korean specialty restaurant in the hotel. Not tried these so No comments. Facilities are basic and manageable. MRT closest is Outram (8 mins walk) and closest shopping is Tiong bahru plaza (12 mins walk) For some western foods like burgers and fries you may need to take the MRT to more tourist places like orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Scraping the barrel”
Reviews.Author: alloverman
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel before checking out, rooms where small, cramped and smelly. Worst of all its impossible to get even a decent nights sleep with outside road traffic and noisy plumbing. You will be constantly woken when the room upstairs flushes his toilet or takes a shower. Being a constant business traveler this hotel is not even in the game for accommodation. To cut a long story short shop around and find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: beajolley
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice but the room was quite small. I appreciated that they offered free Internet but it was a little bit costly.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay here, there are surely better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only very average, there are no amenities so if you like to get some exercise while travelling this hotel does not provide any onsite exercise facilities. The rooms are also extremely small, the bed hard and the shower wall in my room had some mould. Additionally the walls between rooms are paper thin, I was woken several times by people talking in the next room. The restuarant food was ok and the hotel is within walking distance of China Town where you can get excellent food and its a short taxi ride to Orchard Road. Hotel Staff Service was good but I really would not stay there again if I had a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: MeiMeiMee
Reviews.Content: This is my 7th time for staying at this hotel. I like location and cleanliness very much. Service is ok but rooms are small as others said. However, most of my time did not stay in the room so it's alright. It's easy to go to Orchard, Chinatown, Bugis and Sentosa by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amitkul
Reviews.Content: Location is good. Near to Metro station. Rooms are not that great. Overall comfirtable. Breakfast is good. Rest it is normal sort of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable beds, rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: tcgc65
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of August until 3rd September. I came by myself as my parents were coming back from Europe and were having a stopover in Singapore. Their travel agent assured them that this hotel was excellent, so of course I wanted to stay with them when they arrived so I booked the hotel too. Imagine my surprise when I get there (the staff were very friendly though), the hotel is old, my room was a total shock and I got told I had been upgraded. The room was wide enough to have a queen bed and a side table on each side. At the end was a cupboard with a mini fridge inside, small hanging space on the other side and on top was the tv. To the left was a table with reading lamp. Where you would normally put your suitcase was a small fold out table which when you did this was extremely cramped when entering the front door. As previously mentioned in other reports the room needs more lighting. The floor was wooden and so you could hear noise from other rooms. The bathroom was clean, although it was extremely small. I'm glad it was just me in the room and not my husband as well as it would have been extremely crowded. Unfortunately the bed is rock hard and so I woke every day with sore shoulders and neck. I asked each morning if they could put a comforter on the bottom and they said they would, but nothing eventuated, so alas 5 nights of no sleeping, and that is not what you want when you have been out all day and all you want to do is come home eventually to a comfortable bed and sleep soundly. I was also very disapointed in the breakfast each morning. I know I shouldn't have expected anything like the other hotels that I have stayed at in Singapore before, but it was extremely basic. When my parents finally arrived we asked if we could combine our two rooms into one executive suite so that we all could sleep together. They said this could not be done as we had booked two separate rooms. We tried explaining to them that they would be better off as the cost of our two rooms was going to be more expensive than a executive suite and also they would have two other rooms they could use. But they could not understand this, so unfortunately it never happened. I would recommend this hotel only for business travellers (which we noticed alot of business people), as they are just passing through and doing business. I would not recommend it for families or for a longer stay as you are out of the way although the MRT is only about a 10minute walk. I do not think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: felixinbali
Reviews.Content: The images on the website are VERY deceiving. Floor and furnitures look cheap. 270 SGD for what they call a "executive luxury room" is ridiculous. The furnitures and floor look very cheap and are not really maintained. The first room they offered me had dirty bedsheets and the beach in front holes from cigarettes. The second room was better. The room size was ok for a 2 night stay. Front desk was friendly. Cleaner knocked on the door even the do-not-disturb sign was on. Will not return. They offer free internet in the room (wired, not wireless).

Reviews.Title: “A real value for money”
Reviews.Author: Vickz_Nickz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Singapore for 3 day 2 night. Our main agenda was Universal Studios. The hotel is located in Tiong Bahru road 50. The hotel is bigger that we first thought. It is actually 2 building separated by the main road. we stayed at the lotus section (across the main building). When we first step in, we didn't get any warm greeting, but the receptionists at the desk were really helpful. The bellboy are really friendly too! It's a lil walk using the link to the lotus section and the corridor is a little tight. however the rooms are surprisingly spacious for a budget hotel. The room is clean and they provide basic amenities. The beds are comfortable and the comforter will keep you warm at night. Aircons, fridge and a safe are provided in all rooms. The windows are doubled layered (as so i'm told) so there's not much noise from outside. Decor is not too bad. The only downside for me was there's not enough lighting in the room and the walls could use a lil touch up. Bathroom space is small but the shower could fit 2 people in a tight squeeze ;). basic toiletries are also provided. Towels provided are clean. If you're a non muslim there are plenty of places to eat as most of the restaurant around the hotel closes at 5am. In the morning, there's a market place you could walk to and on the first floor it's where there's hawker stalls selling local economic delicacies. Located outside the main building is a convenience shop called cheers. MRT is about 8-10 mins walk. It is not far IF you're used to walking. Using MRT from Outram park to Vivo via Harbour Front station takes only 5 mins. The hotel also provide shuttle service to take hotel guest to MRT, China town and Orchard road every hour. If you are familiar with the bus system there is a bus stop a block away from the hotel. Taking a taxi from the airport is about 15-20 mins drive and it cost us about $15SGD.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Fonty1212
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in July. I was really looking forward to it - especially after staying at some pretty average (and sometimes below average) accommodation whilst travelling in India and Vietnam prior to arriving Singapore. The hotel is about 8-10 minutes walk from the Outram MTR station. It isn't too bad if you don't mind the walking. But if you are someone who prefer to have easy access to transportation, this hotel might not be the ideal place for you to stay. The hotel is made of two buildings linked together by a connecting bridge (thus the name of the hotel). When we were shown our room, I was a bit disappointed by the size of the room. It was an extremely small room and there was hardly any space to store two pieces of standard suitcases. My friend ended up putting her luggage on the dressing table and mine on a chair. Bedsheets, pillow cases and towels were clean and in good condition. However, there really is an issue with the cleanliness of the bathroom. There was a very thick build up of black mould on silicon around the edge of the hand washbasin. There was also evidence of toothpaste (at least I hope it was toothpaste!) on the back of the bathroom door. Mould was also evident on grout in between the wall and floor tiles in the shower case indicating that it had not been cleaned adequately. I was disappointed by this as I had expected the cleanliness of any hotel in Singapore (given the country's reputation), to be more satisfactory than the hotels I stayed in developing countries....Another thing i want to add is that there is only free internet access if you are using your own laptop. If you are using a computer from their business centre, they charge you SGD15 per half an hour (if my memory serves me correctly). Anyway, onto the more positive aspect of the hotel, the hotel is situated very close to the market (about three minutes walk). A hawkers food court is situated above this market. My friend and I ended up going there for breakfast during the three days we were in Singapore. There is a huge variety of foods available and you can purchase a very satisfying meal for under SGD$3.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but no hotel facilities”
Reviews.Author: Staxi
Reviews.Content: We had a very spacious room though after reading through the hotel website we were expecting more from this so-called boutique hotel. The room and the bathroom were simple and clean, the bed was comfy and the storage space was sufficient. Daily breakfast buffet was just OK, though there weren't lots of choices, and it was only Asian and American style. The hotel didn't have a pool or a gym. They had a nice rooftop beergarden which normally should close at 11.30pm. Whenever we arrived there around 11pm, the staff at the end of the bar would immediately switch off the light.... Opposite though was another nice outdoor bar for a late drink.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: viajeroManila
Reviews.Content: For a hotel in a supposedly clean city, the Link proved to be a bit disappointing. I can understand the small rooms, given the fact that there appears to be construction restrictions on buildings in the historic district. The bathroom, however, had molds in the walls. There was a funny smell constantly emanating from the bathroom. I don't know if it was part of the water treatment thing in the city, but the smell can sometimes be bothersome. Location was midway between two MRT stations (Outram Park and Tiong Bahru), both at least 700m away by foot. Usually not a formidable distance, but in sweltering heat or a downpour, the walk can be an ordeal. Thankfully, the bus stop is just across the street. The hotel was very close to Duke University and SGH, but without the meeting organizers providing shuttles, the short walk may just be enough for one to be quite sweaty when one arrives at the meeting venue. In-room internet was a good bonus. Made up for the small rooms. Price of internet access is just right (it's free). Food at Louvre Lounge (breakfast) was average with a so-so selection of western and Asian fare. I still can't place it if I enjoyed my stay at Link or not, hence the "Average" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dirty shower and unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: readyfortravel2010
Reviews.Content: Size of the room was not too bad and location is decent but everything else is horrible. The staff were not friendly and the noise in the room never ended. Between the noise from the rooms next door and the noise from the street, I barely had any sleep. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very comfortable in a good location”
Reviews.Author: EJG-DT
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for a business trip and found this to be located close to the center and also to the MTR 5 minutes walk away. Room was average size with own coffee and tea and mini bar, cable internet connection included in the rate. Good clean shower bathroom and accessories replenished daily. Breakfast facilities very good a nice choice of fresh fruits and local produce, good lounge service and good offers for the world cup, better than the football! Good selection and local restaurants across for the hotel and great fish. Service was good at the hotel and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “average -- in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: kwanchai
Reviews.Content: it is not located close to the town center , even though shuttle bus is available (destinated to the orchard road ) , it is not frequent. Need to walk for 10 mins to the nearest MRT station , but taxi is not expensive in Spore anyway, (remind you, most of the taxi drivers did not know where the hotel is , need to tell them the address and decribed to them the main road nearby) Some of the staff are helpful , but some receptionists just keep a 'mask' face. The cleanliness of the room is acceptable, but the wardrobe has some strange smell when i opened it. Aircond is cool enough. Room size is small but okay for me who stayed alone, definitely too small for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sekiR
Reviews.Content: The room was very small and tight, but the bed was comfortable. Everything in the hotel was simply no-frill, nothing more than simple, yet worth for its room rate. The hotel is not close to the tourist attractions, but there is a local cooked food market next block, with a lot of local deli worth trying.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel needs to be renovated.”
Reviews.Author: TheViking2305
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for three nights. To get from the reception, I needed to go to the 3rd floor and then take a long walk throug halls, with very dirty carpets. Then take a another elevator down to the ground floor and then go out and and walk outside to get to my room. There was no wirless internet available in the room, just one short cable from the wall. The breakfast was ok, but they used plastic dishes. I found that very strange. Maybe it tells you something about the standard of the hotel. I also found the room to have some strange smell in it and it felt dark. The staff was ok, but their english was often too limited.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: udalvr
Reviews.Content: This is my second time here. I enjoyed my stay and have no complaints about the hotel. The only minor issue was that I was assigned a room in the other wing across the road which is connected to the main building via an over bridge on the third floor. But that was not an issue as the other wing had direct access from the road and you need not go all the way to the reception and then the third floor. The room was good, comfortable and clean. The bathroom was clean. I like the location and the free broadband service. Overall is was a nice stay like my previous one. And for MANISHMKSDELHI......I am an Indian holding an Indian passport and residing in India.

Reviews.Title: “Useless place”
Reviews.Author: MANISHMKSDELHI
Reviews.Content: Our Agent Book us for this hotel.. this is loacted in near ChinaTown...Free advise for all indians..please do not book this hotel.. they are only bothered about money..money and money..if at all u made your mind to check in..please be careful about front desk manager FIROOSS!! they will treat u like slaves and will not list a signle word

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: squishy_9
Reviews.Content: This tidy little hotel was a gem to find. Such a good rate in what can be a very expensive city to stay in. Public transport to the main attractions was convenient, and the hotel had a free bus to orchard road. the Hotel staff were outstanding and nothing was ever too much trouble for them. the rooms are on the small side, but still perfectly comfortable. The rooftop bar is a must, such a good place for a drink after a long hot day.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here for more then 1 night”
Reviews.Author: esorlegin
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay in the Link Hotel for 6 nights with my wife. We arrived at 3pm on Dec 9th 2009. The staff on reception did not speak very good English (later, I found out why - see below). We were give very poor directions to our room and it took us 10 minutes to find our way thru the rabbit warren - eventually pointed in the right dierction by a cleaner. I should say the our trip around the hotel was very slow due to the very narrow corridors - only just about enough room for 2 people with cases to pass each other. If there is a house cleaning trolly - it is very tricky. Anyway - we find our room........OH DEAR. VERY small - much smaller than expected - even after reading reviews. Bathroom - lots of mold. Air Conditioning - VERY loud and noisy. Service - cr@p. 'View' from window - remember we are booked in for 6 nights - the back of another building. Why - simple - the hotel has been bought by Bejing Chinese businessmen and is now run along the lines of a chinese hotel - no frills and minimal service and cleaning. Customer Care - what is that? For 1 night it would be OK - any longer, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not centre but great value”
Reviews.Author: Thomari
Reviews.Content: We were going for a short 3-days trip to Singapore and our friends decided to stay in Link Hotel due to the competitive price. Hotel location was not especially centre but we appreciate the not-so-hectic neighbourhood. There are some restaurants nearby and Chinatown is just around the corner. We had a car with us so there was no problem at all for us to move around; Link Hotel was just nice for us. The deluxe room we stayed was clean, not too big but good enough for two. Free internet is provided in the room. Bathroom is a bit tiny for my partner though, but it's clean as well with a nice shower. One thing we disliked about the room is the foul-smell from the bed sheets and pillow cases, we think the they were not dried properly that caused the foul-smelling sheets. Our friends had the same problem. But once the bed sheets were replaced, it was fine. The cleaning service is so so, they did not provide us the replacements for shampoo and bath gel the next day. Apart from above, we were happy with our room with the given price. Up on the rooftop, there is a Beergarden which we personally liked it a lot. Beer is sold at a reasonable price and nice windy quiet environment up there. There is also happy hour session - buy 1 free 1, the staff is great up there on the rooftop. Daily breakfast is included for us but has limited choices; parking is free for hotel guests. Overall, I will still recommend this hotel to save some $ for shopping later!

Reviews.Title: “For the price, one of the best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: browan04
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a few different hotels in Singapore, and for the price, I think this was the best value. It was not ideal, but I think if you're on a budget but still want a comfortable hotel, this is a great option. I booked my hotel on hotels.com under a promotion where you stayed for 3 nights and paid for 2 so I paid $180 for 3 nights. The room was small but adequate with a great shower, a large bed, and a tv with many channels in multiple languages. The hotel is fairly large and occupies two buildings, with one across the street from the other, connected by a skyway so you don't need to go outside. It is (AT MOST) a 7 minute walk to the Outram Park MRT station, but you can easily walk all the way to Chinatown in about 15 minutes. Anyone who thinks the walk is far is lazy or pretentious. I had a large backpack and a suitcase and it was not a problem. I took the MRT from the airport and it took about 45 mins. The bus system in Singapore is amazing, and necessary to get to some sights, such as the zoo, so I recommend using it, and it is even easier to get to the hotel as there is a bus stop right outside. While I may have preferred a hotel closer to the center of the city, the price made is worth it, as I couldn't find a hotel for less than $110/night in other locations.

Reviews.Title: “valuable price with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: george c
Reviews.Content: very convenient location, room not that big but cosy and clean, staff service is excellent. there is one beer garden on the roof top, very good night view, just wonder the guests not too much, beer is very cheap. i heard many local foods around the hotel is very delicious and famous, some of them are really good. the hotel is good for mid range business stay, same as our company.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in expensive Singapore”
Reviews.Author: waggaperth
Reviews.Content: After weeks of research for a reasonable hotel at an acceptable price - we found the Link Hotel. Prices in Singapore have more than doubled since we were there last only three years ago. The link was clean with really nice rooms. Small but big enough and though not central it was just a $5.00 taxi fare into town. Eight of us stayed there for three seperate nights while travelling in and out of Singapore and we all recommend this hotel as a good compromise if you don't want to spend $400.00 or more a night on accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel receptionist in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: lomoloco
Reviews.Content: First, I booked this hotel by its tempting promotion 3-month early booking which includes 60% discount from regular rate and free upgrade to deluxe room. During 3 months before my arrival I sent them a couple e-mails asking such simple enquiries, they never replied but it wasn't a big deal though. At my arrival which it was so busy at the front desk. There's no queue and everyone was trying to get their stuff done first. At least someone behind that desk could do some help, right? They were just ignored and when my turn to check-in they didn't even say 'hello' or 'thank you'. There was no hotel etiquette at that front desk at all. I bet anybody could do this job as worse as they do. And with a little surprise, I didn't get an upgrade to deluxe room and my requested bed which I booked in advance for 3 months. The superior room I stayed was small but can't complain at this kind of hotel. The bathroom has a shower stall and everything was clean. Thank god I didn't have to shower over the toilet! The only worst thing in my room was a bad smell from pillows. After checked-out --- of course, they didn't even say 'thank you' but acting arrogant --- me and friend felt so relieved that we don't stay at this hotel any more. The only best thing and impressive about this hotel was just a friendly doorman. He's very informative and friendly. He should work at the reception desk instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Service and Bad welcome desk service”
Reviews.Author: Deepak_AN
Reviews.Content: This was my First trip to Singapore with Family and I didn’t want to mess it up. I researched a lot and with the help of trip advisor I took a decision to book the Link hotel. After going there and staying for 7 days I am very happy that I didn’t make a wrong decision. The Hotel is situated in the center of all the attractions and tourist places. It is very near to the MRT and the bus stop is just opposite to the Hotel. On my first day I arrived at the hotel around 8 in the morning and it was a shocker that they were not able to locate my reservation. I am not sure where the mess up was but I have to wait for 1 Hr after a 6 Hrs flight and no proper sleep. Then when they were able to locate it they charged me more for early check in (56$) that is ok, but they didn’t have a king bed even though I had made the reservations 2 weeks in advance. I tried explaining to them with the documents I had about the reservation and they did not acknowledge. Then they combined 2 single beds and gave me a room. Then on the second day after a series of discussion I was allotted a King bed room, good thing is they upgraded the room to Superior. The King bed room was not so big, there are no luggage compartments. The beds, ambiance, bath and other amenities were appropriately placed and overall it gave a good felling. The Hotel staff @ the restaurant were courteous. The Hotel is in located very near to the Night market and u have numerous eating joints outside which will be open all thru night. You can hop on a bus and in next 2 stops u will get into China town. Outram MRT is at a walk able distance from the hotel. Overall apart from the first day confusion, it is a great hotel located in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “inconvenient and small room”
Reviews.Author: Neo_Fung
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far from MRT station, approx 15 min walk (it is relatively far as Singapore is really a small city). The lobby is relatively small so as the room. There are two blocks for the hotel, expect to walk 5 mins from the lobby to another block. You also have to walk through other people's room in the third floor. This may means people living in the third floor will be affected by noise and chat. Breakfast is included but not delicious. There are two bars in the hotel, one is in the ground floor opening till late. The roof top bar closed at 2230. The room is small, only able to put two beds and a table, thats all. Do not expect anything for tourists around the hotel as the hotel is located in a residential area. Yet, some local food stalls are available till late around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: loubob07
Reviews.Content: The Link Hotel feels a little bit out of the way, but in reality it is only a 10 minute walk to an MRT station and a little further into the heart of Chinatown. The hotel offers complimentary shuttles into orchard Road and Clarke Quay throughout the day, and we found the service to be really helpful and it saved us a small fortune in cab fares. The hotel rooms are small, but not as small as some people have made them out to be! With a double bed, cabinet, desk, and 2 side tables, there is still just enough room for a walk around the bed and for a couple of big suitcases! The ensuite is also compact, but clean and all in working order. You get a few little toiletries too. Staff were helpful and friendly and always seemed to do all they could for you - particularly true of the concierge team. The restaurant is a little over priced and disappointing, so don't eat there unless you need to, but the roof top bar is good value and has a nice relaxed feel to it. We were in Singapore at the Link Hotel for about one week, and it was all we needed for our city break. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasant stay, the staff were very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownMissionary
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, we arrived very early +- 6.30 and checked in. We then went to see as much of Singapore as we could. The hotel was comfortable, and centrally situated for our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLucyw7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our overnight stay before heading off on another trip. The room was very tiny and had to climb over our luggage to get to the bathroom but room was comfortable and clean. Breakfast was included and was nice. Close to harbour where our cruise ship was leaving and about 30 min trip from airport and around 30 SD. Plenty of friendly taxi staff. We purchased this from a internet accommodation so maybe they have just the smallest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel – just what you need”
Reviews.Author: SJ_sees_the_world
Reviews.Content: The hotel was initially was difficult to find, as we took the MRT, rather than a cab. The website states the two nearest Mass Rapid Train (MRT) stations are Outram MRT Station and Tiong Bahru MRT Station, the nearest tube would be Outram Park. It’s approximately a 10 minute walk. On arrival, the hotel has a nice reception area and swiftly booked us in. We found our room to be adequately sized with a desk, cabinet, tv and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was nice but had a slight odour. We travelled up to East Malaysia from Singapore; the guide book stated that only one Coach Company travels to this area. Although the company had a website, we were unable to book our tickets, so we went to the coach site. As we were only in Singapore for a couple of days, we were keen to book our cheap travel onwards. On arrival, the operator said that there was no available seats on the date we wanted to travel, or the day after, or the day after that, but on the Monday, at 9am, meaning we would miss our next leg of our journey and pay for an additional 3 nights in one of the most expensive cities in the Asia. Looking back now, we ummm’ed and aarrrggg’ed for about 5 minutes. Fortunately for us, this worked and the operator working advised us another coach company close by who travels to East Malaysia. We used Five star tours www.fivestarsonline.com. This operator was slightly cheaper than the other coach company and had available seat, which is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great services”
Reviews.Author: LillyBu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night. The check-in staff was prompt and even apologised for making us wait for 5mins! Our room was in the second building, so we had to carry our own luggage to our room. On first impression, the room was a little on the small size and quite dark. There was not much lighting in the room...However, it was clean and pleasant, so staying here for one night was fine. If we had to stay for more nights, it would have been a problem, cause we would have expected more, considering this was a 4 stars hotel. Our previous stay at a 2 stars hotel in Singapore was much better in comparison. Anyway, the hotel offered a reasonable breakfast buffet, though it was limiting on the choice of food it served. There was a complementary bus service which took guest to Orchard Road and China Town everyday. However, one of the reason we decided to pay a little extra for this hotel was that the website offered complementary airport transfer. This is not true, as this service was extra. Had we known this before we booked the hotel, I doubt we would have paid so much for staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't come back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BiBau
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't come back to this hotel although it's a newly renovated hotel and conveniently located close to the China Town district, due to the following reasons: First, the room is too small. Once you've entered the room the only thing you can do is sit on the bed. Secondly, although it was said to be newly renovated, we were then put in a room with very bad smell from the drainage. Thirdly, breakfast was very poor. And lastly, the concierge and house-keeping staff are nice but front desk staff are not very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cozy”
Reviews.Author: ddiva77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for the weekend. Was actually expecting something different since its a boutique hotel. Almost got lost because the hotel is located on a one-way street. Found out that it's kinda plain with a small room (got the deluxe but still wasn't big ehough). Plus side is that its clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: socamad
Reviews.Content: The hotel was slightly far from the train station (about 10 mins) but it's fairly safe to walk to the station by yourself at night (I did it at around 9pm at night as a lone female). Other than that, the staff were REALLY friendly, particularly two guys in reception who helped me pick my tours for the following day. Also had a massage in the spa on the ground floor which was really good too and GREAT value for money! The location of this hotel is good if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the busier areas of Singapore. Taxis to and from the main locations are pretty cheap, so that's always an option if you don't want to take the train. There's also a bus stop just across the street. Yes, the rooms are small, but that's how all the rooms are in Asia. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The toiletries they provide are really handy (including a shower cap, dental kit and ear buds)! Breakfast was included in my deal (I think I booked directly through the hotel itself). The breakfast was a buffet consisting of Asian food or European style (pastries, cooked meats, fruits, yoghurts etc). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal in singapore but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Manasee
Reviews.Content: Singapore is very expensive city. It was difficult to find good hotel in budget. Link hotel is located near Outram Park MRT station and Tiong Bahru MRT Station. About 10 minutes walking distance. Locality is good as it is residential. Rooms had all amenities but are very tiny. No space for keeping luggage. Not recommended for travelers with lot of luggage. Service at reception was good. We reached 3-4 hours before our check in time but they allotted room to us without any extra charge. They offered free internet. Location is excellent. Recommended for single travelers. Tiong Bahru market is at just 5 minutes walk where you can get local cuisines at very cheaper rates. 2 vegetarian food outlets are available in that market. Nice bakery in front of hotel and restaurant also. This restaurant's timing is 6 pm to 6 am. You can get good food and drink in late night also.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but clean, comfortable and very value for money”
Reviews.Author: greenflubber
Reviews.Content: It was a short trip for me as I was in Singapore for the weekend for a friend's wedding. Link Hotel has been refurbished from an old HDB building (Singapore's equivalent to public housing) and it has been beautifully done up, so it was nice to actually have a bit of heritage and history in the hotel. The rooms are incredibly small though, and that's saying a lot for someone who lives in Hong Kong! That aside, the furnishing are tastefully done and the beds + sheets are clean and comfortable. I reckon we had the most basic room and it came with tea+coffee, kettle, tv, mini-fridge, safe, shampoo/conditioner, flat-screen plasma TV (with CNN and other major cable channels). Service was excellent - when I checked-in I asked the front desk for information on a particular restaurant nearby (check out Capitol Restaurant if you have the time, it's about a 15-minute walk and it serves fantastic seafood. Ask for the specialty: steamed Sultan Fish) and they printed out a 3-page internet website of the restaurant and delivered it to our room. With a smile. Nice! The only fault is that the toilet exhaust isn't strong enough to remove the humidity (Singapore is often very humid) so as a result there were many "flies" in the toilet. They aren't fruit-flies, but small flies that were "stuck" on the ceiling. They didn't bother me but it just gave the impression that the toilet wasn't very clean. After the room service on the first morning, they were gone though. Will I stay there again? Yes, absolutely. Especially for its good location (short taxi ride to Zouk, Singapore's best nightclub) and its comfortable rooms. If you intend to spend a lot of time in the hotel, then choose another place to stay. If not, then you've got the best hotel you can get for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: annemarienz
Reviews.Content: Small, fairly basic room but nicely furnished and decorated and providing all the necessities and an excellent base for sightseeing. Close enough walk to both Outram Park and Tiong Bahru station but also an easy enough walk to china town and on to the city and Clarke Quay. Staff were perfectly hospitable and local area was interesting to wander around. Would recommend for a value for money alternative in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fine solution”
Reviews.Author: reevery
Reviews.Content: I was in what was obviously a recently refurbished room, which was small but very clean. My main gripe about the rooms was that there is a fair amount of noise from adjacent rooms, I certainly noticed running water from one side, and a squeaky door and the hoover on the other. Despite being next to a major road, however, this was not a bother. I didn't have the breakfast but I was not impressed by the live music in the bar in the evening - I suspect this was enjoyable for Asians but it didn't impress me. I will point out though, this hasn't affected my ratings, because I had a choice not to listen to it, so I left after one drink. Location-wise, this is an interesting call. The MRT is a good 10-15 minutes walk but Outram Road MRT is an interchange with direct services to the harbour (for Sentosa), Chinatown and Little India on one line, and the CBD and City Hall on the other. There is a 7-11 equivalent practially next door, and very adequate restaurants within 100 yards of the hotel doors. There is no Wi-fi in the rooms but there is a Cat-5 cable sticking out of the wall - not all that long - but still there is internet if you need it. All in all, this is a decent choice for a brief stop in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkt_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Link Hotel on Feb. The hotel looks pretty new. Have nothing to complain about, despite the room size that was smallish. The hotel and room are clean and trendy looking, shower also has a good pressure. We didn't eat at the hotel at all since we were out for traveling the whole day. You have to walk for about 10 minutes to the closest MRT station (Outram, in front of SGH) in which will caused you trouble when its raining, but there is a bus station just across the street, so its pretty convinient. Also the free wifi in our room added the value for staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Queen_Of_Hearts25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of the Singapore Airlines stopover program and it was fine .. The room was small but clean and cosy .. the room had a safe for those imprtant items that need to be secured. I didnt see much of the hotel as i was there for a day and joined a tour the next day to do some siteseeing . I had no Problems while i stayed here

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gentle_Ben_27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights during Feb 2009. The room was a good size, with everything you would need.....safety deposit box, tea and coffee facilities, hair dryer etc. The reception staff could have done with a bit of a cheerier disposition, but all other staff were great. The situation of the hotel was great for the underground and Chinatown. There was a "Cheers" 24 hour convienience shop attached to the hotel, as well as a fab restaurant opposite. I would reccommend this hotel for anyone who wants to have a clean, pleasant and reasonably priced stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bed, trendily furnished rooms at good price!”
Reviews.Author: BbHugger
Reviews.Content: Firstly would like to say I've stayed from 5 star hotels to budget rooms all over the world and am very picky when it comes to comfort and cleanliness. I really loved my stay here, and will definitely come back again. Rooms are cozily furnished with a Very Comfortable and soft queen sized Bed. The bed is the best thing about this hotel, the duvet is soft, thick and premium, unlike many other hotels at a similar price which would provide thin sheets. Owners should take note to keep up the standard! Room is not very big but clean and has good decor. Cupboard is ornate and gives the room a upscale feel. Slippers and cable TV provided as expected and no problems. Bathroom is clean and has good fittings, with a very hot shower. Problems are that the walls may needs maintaining, some stains were seen which my wife complained about and really can lower the standard if it gets worse. Wireless internet is also usually free in many hotels today and strangely here it's charged here at sky high prices (20+ dollars). I would stay at a comparable hotel with free wireless as the Internet is like oxygen for most travellers today. Breakfast was not included at the price, but can be easily gotten at the Tiong Bahru Food Court nearby, which offers 2-3 dollar delicious hawker foods. Overall a good place for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice though Small!”
Reviews.Author: ShilaK
Reviews.Content: Husband had a conference last 5th to 6th and we decided to make a trip out of it. We arrived at the hotel really late, close to 11pm. Happily check-in was fast and we then took the lift to the next floor up. A 2 mins walk down the loooooong and narrow corridor to our room. (can't believe that this used to be residential flats- people actually LIVED here). Opened the door - slight gasp- the room was small. Really really small . Facilities were of good standard though (ie no mold in toilet) and it came with all the extras you'd expect of a maybe 4 star- place-coffee tea hairdryer free shampoo nice towels and even slippers and CNN! Bed was comfy and in plain white. Curtain very thick and you know why as our room overlooked the back of some local restaurants! Area was quiet though. The most fantastic thing about LinkHotel , is the FREE INTERNET CONNECTION!! The next day's breakfast was at the inhouse coffee house, Reasonably good buffet. SGD15 is such good value. We wanted to try Persimmon the restaurant but it had very limited opening times which clashed with our shopping times! I took the shuttle to Orchard Road - found it convenient although not direct as bus also picked up other guests. The staff could do with being more knowledgable on local info though. We were looking for places we can have a late dinner and they had very few recommendations (found other places the next day) but everyone was friendly enough. All in all, very good for brief stay if you are not going to be in your room much or if you don't mind the size (or lack thereof)...if you suffer from claustrophobia, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stopover near harbourfront”
Reviews.Author: lillabuggles
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotelclub. Got in early in the morning and needed somewhere to rest before getting on a cruise at the Harbourfront the next day. The Link was perfect. Check in was easy and the reception area very nice. Room was small but nicely decorated and very comfortable. Shower was fine and good toiletries. I would definately recommend it as a place to stay for similar reasons. Close to Vivocity and harbourfront (about 5-10 min by taxi). Ordered room service which was above average. Check out very easy and they called us a cab no drama. Overall very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “probably reasonable value for singapore”
Reviews.Author: ughboot
Reviews.Content: We haven't stayed in Singapore before, but this hotel seemed to be reasonable value from the choice provided as part of a Singapore Airlines stop-over. The transport from the airport to the hotel was good. The reception service was fine. We ordered room service one night which was above average. The rooms were tiny but clean. The hotel shuttle wasn't convenient for us, we would recommend the public transport - its clean, fast, with lots of services. The train station is an easy ten minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: Shawyun
Reviews.Content: I've been staying there for 5 nights, I'm really enjoy staying with them, as the staff is very helpful and informative. The room is well equip. Even the room and wash room are small, what i need is a decent place to sleep, rest and bath. Compare the room rate and facilities, it's worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & cheerful”
Reviews.Author: DomGloucester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of Singapore Airlines stopover, transport to hotel was fine, knew beforehand that it was a bit further out. Hotel is located on a busy junction, but windows are double glazed so do insulate from the noise. Rooms are tiny as are the bathrooms which also suffer from the 'asia drains' smell. Hotel feels functional and does not have much ambiance, the breakfast is in the bar area and tables are low and seats are sofas if the normal tables & chairs are full. Food is Ok, but nothing special and even though had 50% discount the 10%service charge was calculated on the full price!.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: serriWales
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel when my parent came for my ROM day. Horrible experience with it. Receptionist doesn't speaker fluent english.. Rooms are so small and bathroom can't even fit two person in it. They provide free shutter bus service to orchard and clarke quay. Waited hours but no bus came and pick us up. Phone to the receptionist but the receptionist just keep asking us to wait... they even ask us to wait for 3 hours....and claim that we miss the previous bus.. the main problem is that we have been waiting there for an hour.... I'm so dissapointed with their service... as I'm rushing for my ROM dinner. Lastly I took the taxi back to the hotel. Just beware, although room price quote in the internet is nett but they have another 10% service charge per night not inclusive in it. Got a shock when the bills came. Price is not inclusive of breakfast. Not budget nor 4 star at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean but Small”
Reviews.Author: MeiMeiMee
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel. I will come back to stay again. It is very convenient to find foods, just across the road to Tiong Bahru market (hawker centre). It is also very convenient to go anywhere by bus. If you don't familiar with bus, you can take bus no. 16 (I can remember only 1 no.) only 3 bus stops will reach Tiong Bahru MRT (green line). You also can go to Chinatown easy also just get out from the back of the hotel. The room is very clean but small. Anyway, I don't stay in the room much so I don't mind. I don't like to stay another building. I prefer to stay at the same buidling as the reception area. Like others said, it's very long corridor and yes sometimes spooky. However, I will definitely go back to stay this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Link Hotel - a budget hotel not three or four star”
Reviews.Author: Ricc0
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night for the Singapore Stopover. The room has fresh white sheets and lovely white towels, nice toiletries and white slippers. It was however, tiny and has absolutely no ambience. I found the long narrow corridor abit spooky and the long walk across the bridge was confusing, There was a tiny wardrobe. The reception staff looked as though they were overworked/ weary and was wanting of a welcoming smile. I had seen the hotel rating as a four star which is outrageous. Even its rating as a three star is generous. I'll rate it as a one- two star.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in residential Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Dylan65
Reviews.Content: Due to the hike in prices for the Singapore Grand Prix we were forced to book here as the room rates were more reasonable. Luckily for us one of our party checked the internet rates before we flew out and they had changed in our favour. The Government fix the prices. We advised the hotel of this and they amended our booking. The rooms are compact but clean and the hotel has a more intimate flavour to it. There are on site massage facilities and the hotel is noted by the link 'bridge' from one side of the very busy road to the other. This hotel is located in a residential part of Singapore, expect local cuisine in nearby cafes. The hotel is sandwiched in the middle of two metro stations - Outram Park and Tiong Bahru, but we mainly used Outram Park as it is a connecting station. It is about 10 minutes walk to either station. Taxis and the metro are cheap to use and you don't have to haggle. If you find you are lost, we found the Singaporeans took their time to be helpful, which is something you don't get in many cosmopolitan cities.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JPRL-UK
Reviews.Content: Good business type hotel but not fantastic. Good location, good standard but small rooms and not much luggage space. Not for couples who have big bags. Free wired internet which is always good for business travellers. Fair price for the standard. No gym or pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not for western tourists.”
Reviews.Author: Paul38
Reviews.Content: This is not exactly a tourist hotel but it is clean and comfortable. It has all the facilities of a 4 star hotel including a business centre, but beware they charge $17 for 30 minutes internet usage. The hotel is located near Outram Park. Taxis are readily available and the station is about a 10 minute walk away. The rooms have a modern bathroom with shower, flat screen TV, a safe in the wardrobe, a mini-bar and tea/coffee making facilities. The staff were polite and friendly. As I said, it's not exactly a tourist hotel but then again Singapore isn't exactly the most thrilling place on earth either.

Reviews.Title: “Truly awful”
Reviews.Author: AnnaChristchurch
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Link hotel courtesy of Singapore Airlines after some flight rescheduling. The hotel has been adapted from former Housing Development Board flats and sits on both sides of the road connected by an overbridge. If you are disabled walking the long distance across the bridge connecting the two sides would be a major problem. The standard rooms are the smallest I have ever seen - too small for my husband and I to pass at the end of the bed and too small to open the suitcase. The beds were hard and the air-conditioning was incredibly noisy. The bathroom had a strong smell of sewage that was nauseating. We had 3 rooms booked at the hotel and all smelt the same. The breakfast buffet was very average and incidental cups of tea just about broke the bank. It is handy to many attractions but everything is in Singapore.I will not be staying there again and am suprised that Singapore Airlines thinks it of high enough standard to use for their stop-overs.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: westieak
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights on a singapore airlines stopover package. the hotel has only been open for 6 months and is extremely clean. all the staff are very friendly and helpfull. it is about half an hour from the airport (at night) there are lots of excellent cheap eating places nearby. air con in my room was noisy, hotel was very good value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Clean & cozy, good location”
Reviews.Author: sandrinagracia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for family vacation in June 2008. The hotel was clean & spotless. The service was okay, except when I tried to call housekeeping several times, there was no response. The room was a little bit smaller than other Singapore hotels I stayed before. No movie channels. The hotel is located near Tiong Bahru MRT station (10' walk) and Outram Park station (7' walked), and within 5' walk you can find Tiong Bahru Market that has plenty of good food stalls. The conclusion : we were quite satisfied with the hotel, and may stay again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Okay a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Oyster4
Reviews.Content: Booked through Singapore Air Stopover. Stayed one night while in transit. The hotel is a bit out of the way if you are here for a short time on an extended layover. The room itself was very small and smelled as if someone had been smoking in it. It was okay for what it was. The nicest thing was the LCD TV. The staff were friendly. If I were to do it again I would of booked at the Crown Plaza which is connected to Terminal 3 and saved myself a couple hours of sleep before the flight.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel. value for money given the location.”
Reviews.Author: russiabear
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights in a superior room. comes in 4 themes, Chinese, Indian, Malay, and Modern. dont ask me which one my room was themed after, i dont know any different. value for money: price is just about right, given size of room, quality of room and location of hotel. hotel room: size is just a little small, but that's ok given that its not a room to be enjoyed but to sleep in. they have cable tv (korean, japanese, sports, news, etc) and LCD tv so that's pretty cool. toilet: no bath, just shower. however, the toilet gave out a stink smell. not very obvious if you leave the door open and aircon turned on. but if you are in the bathroom, you can smell the stink. maybe its just my room, or those that are connected to the same faulty plumbing. internet access: free! that's a plus point. and when you check in, they ask if you know how to use it, and if you have a laptop, they will offer you a LAN cable for connection. of course, you would have to return it or they will charge it to your room, haha. distance to nearest MRT station: not too good. have to walk quite a distance, as it is smack right between the 2 nearest stations. getting a taxi: not many taxi drivers know about this hotel, as its not very well known yet. even if it is probably the ONLY hotel in these parts. since a majority of drivers are chinese, if you can tell them the chinese name (which is nothing like link hotel, duh!), they can probably relate to it better. of course, showing the map of the hotel location might help a bit. nearby food and convenience kiosk: 5 stars! the famous tiong bahru food court (upgraded to a 2-storey building recently) and a few seafood restaurants are just a walk around the block. one seafood restaurant turned me off. i waited 30 min and then checked with the waitress, only to find that the food will take another 30 min. i left at that point. moral of the story: ask before you sit down how long it will take for your orders to be served. and next to the food court is a 7-11 24-hour convenience outlet. next to the 7-11 is a nice little restaurant that sells shanghainese food, like small dragon steamed buns, fried rice cakes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy stay with Link Hotel”
Reviews.Author: david988
Reviews.Content: Early this year I made a short business trip to Singapore from Taipei, and found myself in a new and comfortable stay with Link Hotel. Among other things, the room was clean and cozy, and the people were friendly. The small pub was nice too, and to my surprise they had an interesting collection of red wines.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique or Bijou?”
Reviews.Author: kipper084
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Link Hotel, mid week in April. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms are well furnished and comfortable. A nice range of complimentary toiletries were supplied in the bathroom. Although the hotel emphasised the themed rooms, we were not given any options. The room was ideal for a couple of nights but would have been a bit claustrophobic for any longer. If you require an extra bed or would need a travel cot in the room be sure to check out the size of the room as we found it difficult to fit in a travel cot We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant, which although more expensive than the local eateries. was very nicely presented. The local area is interesting and about a seven minute easy walk from the MRT which is very efficient and can comfortably get you around Singapore in a short time. Overall I would say an ideal short-stay hotel for couples, looking for cleanliness and comfort but not wanting to spend too much time in their room. .

Reviews.Title: “Love the comforter”
Reviews.Author: MalayLady
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Link Hotel and was greeted by a friendly bellman who helped open the taxi door and picked up my baggage. Check in was quick and easy, and i was brought to my room by the same bellman who had helped me out the taxi. He told me the Link Hotel got its name from the link bridge which linked the main hotel building with a second building across the road. My room was on the second building and it was a pretty long walk from the lobby. So I would recommend you to request a room at the main building, cuz it would be much much easier. the room was very small, i must agree. but it was clean and the furnishing are new. the bed was comfy with a nice fluffy comforter. the tv had a very limited choice of channels. the bathroom only had a shower, but it is ok for me. the basic amenities are adequate. But i did not notice any theme in my room as other reviewers. However, the bathroom a bit smelly, i suppose it is because of the old pipeworks considering the hotel is an old building. I went for business trip, so i dont get enough time to tour the area around the hotel. anyhow it is situated near chinatown so there are a lot of chinese restaurants and a Tiong Bahru Market nearby. However, through my week's stay at the hotel, i went to Tiong Bahru Plaza, a shopping mall, about 10mins walk from the hotel for dinner. Among Halal eateries available are the common fast food outlets, Mr Teh Tarik and another restaurant at the top floor. All in all, i dont mind to stay at this hotel again, as it was a nice place to stay for a person travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant surprise”
Reviews.Author: chye82
Reviews.Content: Booked a night stay at the hotel on New Year's Eve. There was a promotion going on and I got the room at SGD $180 for a night stay. Their usual prices per night will be about $220+. Located in the heartlands of Singapore, this is very unusual for a hotel. There weren’t many problems during check in, front desk personnel are friendly and I got my room relatively fast. Room was a nice surprise. I got the Chinese Theme room, and I really like the décor of the room, especially the lights makes the room looks really romantic. Toilet is clean, though a bathtub will be nice. I am quite surprised that previous reviews about this hotel complained about the size of the room. I find the size relatively decent. Trust me; I have been to smaller rooms in Singapore before. However, I do agree that if I pay $220+ for a night, I will be expecting more. Location-wise I think the hotel is really unique. There are many food stalls just at your door step. There is the famous Tiong Bahru market, famous among Singaporeans, offering cheap and great local food fare. There is also a seafood restaurant located just across the road. The restaurant opens till late, and offer decent quality of seafood. There is also a 24 hour Hong Kong Café just beside that can satisfy your dim sum cravings in the middle of the night. The hotel is not really accessible, especially for tourists that may not know their way around Singapore well. The hotel is located in between Tiong Bahru Plaze and Chinatown. For tourists, you may need to take a bus or taxi in order to travel to attractions in Singapore. However, if you wish to stay like a Singaporean, there is no better choice then link, as it is surrounded by HDB flats, with market food available easily.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: jubilee1874
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few days earlier this month and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is very new and clean. All of the staff members were extremely cordial and helpful. The Tiong Bahru hawker market is nearby (5 min walk) and if you don't mind a good walk, Chinatown and Clarke Quay are also not terribly far. (I think maybe 15-20 mins to Chinatown and another 10 to Clarke Quay.) I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting location!”
Reviews.Author: LPY123
Reviews.Content: Having lived in the East all my life, it was great to discover this hotel in Tiong Bahru. I never knew Tiong Bahru is so interesting! The hotel is smacked in the middle of some very good food (loved the steamboat behind the hotel) and cute architecture. Reminds me of my granny's place (torn down now :( ). Booked a superior room. Room is small but neat and clean. I like the size actually. More cosy. The day view and night view is very different. In the day, the room is full of light. At night, the warm, cosy lighting is good to fall asleep in. Maybe because I haven't been to hotel in long time but I like the fluffy blanket. Not like what we have last time, the hospital-like blankets. Just opposite the hotel is a Hong Kong Cafe. Great if you want a bite at night but don't want room service. We wanted to go clubbing but didn't know what bus to take. Asked the conceirge who told us they have shuttle service to Chinatown. Near enough and free also. I think our room was a Malay because of the drawing on the wall, some kampung painting. Maybe next time I'll book again and ask for another theme.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: greenslipper
Reviews.Content: i stayed 3 nights here, its been a horrible experience. the room is over priced. this hotel has two buildings, i didn't stay at the main building. the walk to my room was really far from the main building. and confusing too. got lost few times. from the main floor, i need to take elevator to the third floor and then walk to the second building, then take the elevator down to 2nd floor (where i am staying) and walk. i would say the walk to my room from the lobby was over 10 minutes. very very inconvenient. not to mention the room is small and the A/C is extremely loud. more like living in a refrigerator. hall way is not nicely done with sound proof. it is a noisy hotel. so are the guests. lots of tour group stays here, i do not recommend business travelers stay here. too loud, lack of good night sleep will stay with you until you check out. this can be the worst hotel i ever stayed in Asia. and its far away from everything, i need to take the taxi whenever i need to go out. just too inconvenient. never again i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Boris04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very poor value compared to other better known and better situated hotels in Singapore. But even more disappointing is the size of the 'Superior' room. I think the management have confused 'boutique' with 'compact'. One of the features of Asian hotel rooms has been their generous size, but this was the smallest room I have stayed in in Asia, irrespective of the price. I mentioned this to the duty manager on checkout, but he was defensive and I was left with the impression that he thought my opinion was worthless. There were other irritants such as their advertised internet not being available for the whole of our one day stay ('server down' - it takes more than 24 hours to fix? In Singapore?), and no morning paper. Only a small thing, but expected at these prices. It was amusing when I mentioned these matters to the duty manager on checkout. He said yes, we have internet, to which the checkout clerk whispered out of the side of her mouth 'it's down', and then, when I mentioned about the paper, another whisper out of the side of her mouth 'on request'!. All of this is a pity really because the area where the hotel is situated has a certain calmness to it after the hurly burly of other parts of Singapore, and presents another aspect of Singapore that many tourists will enjoy. The areas 'coffeshops' and the food that they serve is well worth a visit. I wouldn't mind staying in this area again, but not at the Link at these prices, and not in a room that size in any hotel in Singapore.

HotelInfo.Name: Link Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 50 Tiong Bahru Rd, Singapore 168733, Singapore
